body_html:
@drpngx Are you referring to this comment or another comment from @fnl?

FWIW, I was able to get a full build using bazel build -c opt --copt=-march=native //... on an AVX2 machine, so I'm somewhat skeptical that the Tensor include is needed in the FixedNum file. I'm working on getting a Skylake build going (I'm on OSX, and Apple's clang crashes on --copt=-march=skylake).
body_text:
@drpngx Are you referring to this comment or another comment from @fnl?
FWIW, I was able to get a full build using bazel build -c opt --copt=-march=native //... on an AVX2 machine, so I'm somewhat skeptical that the Tensor include is needed in the FixedNum file. I'm working on getting a Skylake build going (I'm on OSX, and Apple's clang crashes on --copt=-march=skylake).
body:
@drpngx Are you referring to [this comment](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/6558#issuecomment-269643996) or another comment from @fnl?

FWIW, I was able to get a full build using `bazel build -c opt --copt=-march=native //...` on an AVX2 machine, so I'm somewhat skeptical that the Tensor include is needed in the FixedNum file. I'm working on getting a Skylake build going (I'm on OSX, and Apple's clang crashes on `--copt=-march=skylake`).
